organization_structure_and_focus.qText: Do you have an interesting introduction that states the main idea of the composition and previews what is to follow?
Does your composition have unity? That is, do all your sentences relate to the main idea?
Is your composition coherent? That is, are your ideas arranged logically with transitions that clarify the relationships among them?
Do you have a strong conclusion that follows from and supports your main idea?

content_and_development_of_ideas.qText: Are your ideas clear and interesting?
Is your main idea well defined and focused?
Have you supported your main idea with relevant facts, definitions, quotations, and other supporting information?
Have you added depth to your ideas by including a variety of viewpoints and making connections among key ideas?

use_of_language.qText: Did you establish and maintain a style appropriate to the occasion and purpose?
use_of_language.heading: Style and Voice

use_of_language.qText: Does the composition sound as though you wrote it? (Is the voice appropriate for the topic and purpose?)
Does your writing show that you care about your subject?
Are your words precise, vivid, and specific?
use_of_language.heading: Word Choice

use_of_language.qText: Have you used strong verbs in the active voice when possible?
Do your words create pictures for the reader or appeal to the reader's senses?
Did you eliminate short, choppy sentences by combining related sentences?
use_of_language.heading: Sentence Fluency

use_of_language.qText: Did you vary the length and beginnings of your sentences?
Did you eliminate rambling sentences?
Are your sentences free of redundancy and empty expressions?

conventions.qText: Are your sentences free of errors in grammar and usage?
Did you spell each word correctly?
Did you use capital letters where needed?
Did you punctuate sentences correctly?

organization_structure_and_focus.qText: Do you have an interesting introduction that states the claim clearly?
Does the essay contain clear arguments organized in logical order (from least important to most important, for example)?
Does your composition have unity? That is, do all your sentences work together to meet the purpose of the essay?
Is your composition coherent? That is, are your ideas arranged logically with transitions that clarify the relationships among them?
Do you have a strong conclusion that follows from and supports your main idea?

content_and_development_of_ideas.qText: Does the essay make a strong claim?
Does your essay contain logical reasons supported by evidence?
Do you support your claim with evidence such as facts, examples, and expert opinions from reliable sources?
Does the essay include discussion of opposing views?
Do you include different ways to display evidence, such as graphs, tables, and graphics, if relevant?
Do you avoid overemotional appeals?
Do you avoid overgeneralized statements?
Do you avoid invalid deductive reasoning?

use_of_language.qText: Did you establish and maintain a style appropriate to the occasion and purpose?
use_of_language.heading: Style and Voice

use_of_language.qText: Is the writing voice authoritative and confident?
Is the voice formal and respectful?
Does your writing show that you care about your subject?
Are your words precise, vivid, and specific?
use_of_language.heading: Word Choice

use_of_language.qText: Have you used strong verbs in the active voice when possible?
Do all sentences flow smoothly?
use_of_language.heading: Sentence Fluency

use_of_language.qText: Are there a variety of sentence types and lengths?
Are all sentences well constructed and complete?

conventions.qText: Are your sentences free of errors in grammar and usage?
Did you spell each word correctly?
Did you use capital letters where needed?
Did you puntuate sentences correctly?

organization_structure_and_focus.qText: Does your introduction engage your reader and establish a setting, a situation, characters, and you as the narrator?
Does the sequence of events flow naturally with transitions?
Do you have a strong conclusion that follows from and reflects on the experience?

content_and_development_of_ideas.qText: Did you use a variety of narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, and reflection?
Do you include details that vividly develop experiences, events, and/or characters in the narrative?

use_of_language.qText: Does the writing convey your own voice and personality?
use_of_language.heading: Style and Voice

use_of_language.qText: Are your words precise, vivid, and specific?
use_of_language.heading: Word Choice

use_of_language.qText: Have you used sensory details to create vivid scenes?
Did you use the active voice whenever possible?
Did you vary the length, structure, and beginnings of your sentences?
use_of_language.heading: Sentence Fluency

use_of_language.qText: Are your sentences well constructed?

conventions.qText: Are your sentences free of errors in grammar and usage?
Did you spell each word correctly?
Did you use capital letters where needed?
Did you puntuate sentences correctly?
Did you indent each paragraph?

organization_structure_and_focus.qText: Do your first lines engage your reader and establish a narrator and a situation?
Do events flow naturally, if it is a narrative poem?
Does the final stanza or line leave the reader with a powerful image, idea, or emotion?

content_and_development_of_ideas.qText: Do you include concrete details that ground the poem?
Do you avoid “telling” your ideas directly?

use_of_language.qText: Is there a consistent, clear voice throughout the poem?
use_of_language.heading: Style and Voice

use_of_language.qText: Did you effectively use repetition: rhyme, assonance, alliteration, anaphora?
use_of_language.heading: Poetic Devices

use_of_language.qText: Did you take advantage of line breaks to emphasize words at the beginning and the end of lines?
Are your words precise, vivid, and specific?
use_of_language.heading: Word Choice

use_of_language.qText: Have you used sensory details?
Did you use the active voice whenever possible?

conventions.qText: Is your poem free of errors in grammar and usage?
Did you spell each word correctly?
Did you use capital letters where needed?

organization_structure_and_focus.qText: Are the author and work you will discuss mentioned in your introduction?
Does your introduction contain a clearly worded thesis statement?
Does your conclusion follow from and reinforce your thesis statement?

content_and_development_of_ideas.qText: Does your thesis statement clearly state your main idea, or the claim you are making about the work of literature?
Does the body of your composition provide ample details and evidence from the work to support your thesis?
Did you use quotations from the work to provide evidence for your ideas?

use_of_language.qText: Does your interest in your subject come through in your writing?
use_of_language.heading: Style and Voice

use_of_language.qText: Do you sound as if you believe what you are saying about the literature?
Did you use lively, specific words?
use_of_language.heading: Word Choice

use_of_language.qText: Did you include transition words to show the relationships among ideas and to guide readers to the conclusion?
Are your sentences varied in length and structure?
use_of_language.heading: Sentence Fluency

use_of_language.qText: Do the sentences flow naturally?

conventions.qText: Are your sentences free of errors in grammar and usage?
Did you spell each word correctly?
Did you use capital letters where needed?
Did you punctuate sentences correctly?

organization_structure_and_focus.qText: Do you have an interesting introduction that states the claim clearly?
Does your work have unity? That is, do your sentences work together to meet the purpose of the essay?
Is your work coherent? That is, are your ideas arranged logically with transitions that clarify the relationships among them?
Do you have a strong conclusion that follows from your main ideas?

content_and_development_of_ideas.qText: Do you support your claim with evidence such as facts, examples, and expert opinions from reliable sources?
Does your essay contain logical reasons supported by evidence?
Do you include different ways to display evidence, such as graphs, tables, and graphics, if relevant?
Do you employ rhetorical devices appropriately and avoid faulty reasoning?

use_of_language.qText: Did you establish and maintain a style appropriate to the occasion and purpose?

Are all sentences well constructed and complete?

organization_structure_and_focus.qText: Does your introduction engage your reader and establish a setting, a situation (conflict), characters, and a narrator?
Does the sequence of events flow naturally with transitions?
Do the conflict build to a climax and then end with the resolution?

content_and_development_of_ideas.qText: Did you use a variety of narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, and reflection?
Do you include details that vividly develop experiences, events, and/or characters?

use_of_language.qText: Does each character have a unique voice?

use_of_language.qText: Does your writing show that you care about the characters?
Are your words precise, vivid, and specific?

options.value: What do you think my poem describes? </br>Does my poem follow the 5, 7, 5 syllable pattern?
Was there anything that did not seem to belong? If so, what and why?
Was there anything that did not seem to belong?  If so, what and why?
Can you think of any other questions that would help make my writing better?
What was your favorite part of the poem?  Why?
What do you think my poem describes?
Does my poem follow the 3, 3, 2, 2, 3 beat pattern?
Was there anything that did not seem to belong?  If so, what and why?
Can you think of any other questions that would help make my writing better?
What was your favorite part of the poem? Why?
What do you think my poem describes?
Does my poem follow the diamante pattern?  (topic, 2 describing, 3 action, 4 word phrase, 3 action, 2 describing, synonym)
Was there anything that did not seem to fit?  If so, what and why?
Can you think of any other questions that would help make my writing better?
What was your favorite part of the poem?  Why?
Does my opening paragraph feel like the beginning of a conversation?
Did I share interesting information and ask questions?
Does my ending paragraph sound like the end of a conversation?
Can you think of any other questions that would help make my writing better?
What was the most interesting part of my letter? Why?
If you were the receiver of this letter, would you know exactly what to do in response to my letter?
Can you think of any other questions that would help make my writing better?
What was the most effective part of my letter? Why?
Did my opening make you want to keep reading?
Can you briefly retell what you heard and understood during the read aloud?
Was there anything that did not seem to belong? If so, what and why?
Was there anything that you wanted to know more about? If so, what and why?
Did I finish with a strong, satisfying ending? Why or why not?
Can you think of any other questions that would help improve my writing?
